response.original_title: Texas Performance Guide: Fixing Norton "Error 8504, 104" and GPU Driver Conflicts
response.overview: Texas Norton Helpline: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: Texas users with high-end workstations often face Error 8504, 104. Technically, this is a Runtime Rendering Conflict. Nortonâ€™s SymHTML engine, which draws the user interface, conflicts with the DirectX hooks of modern GPU drivers. This "Race Condition" results in a memory deadlock in the Non-Paged Pool, causing the Norton service to crash and display a "Security Engine Failure" alert. Advanced Restoration Protocols: DDU Cleanup: Use the Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU) in Safe Mode to clear conflicting graphics residues. Norton UI Hook Bypass: Modify the Norton engine settings to use "Legacy Rendering" via the internal developer flags. Heap Memory Expansion: Increase the Windows desktop heap size to prevent the 8504 error from recurring during high-load tasks.
